repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: if we do this, we should also remove the `!(flags & kNluaPushSpecial)` condition here, so that the (less intrusive) metatable tag is used instead.
these are a bit redundant, it is enough to use `return vim.tbl_isempty(vim.api.nvim_call_function("FooFunc", {5}))` (tbl_isempty throws an error for a non-table)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1205,8 +1205,13 @@ describe('lua stdlib', function()
     ]])
     eq(true, exec_lua([[return next(vim.fn.FooFunc(3)) == nil ]]))
     eq(3, eval('g:test'))
-    -- compat: nvim_call_function uses "special" value for empty dict
-    eq(true, exec_lua([[return next(vim.api.nvim_call_function("FooFunc", {5})) == true ]]))
+    eq(
+      { {}, true, true },
+      exec_lua([[
+    local ret = vim.api.nvim_call_function("FooFunc", {5})
+    return {ret, vim.tbl_isempty(ret), next(ret) == nil}

@@ -1205,8 +1205,13 @@ describe('lua stdlib', function()
     ]])
     eq(true, exec_lua([[return next(vim.fn.FooFunc(3)) == nil ]]))
     eq(3, eval('g:test'))
-    -- compat: nvim_call_function uses "special" value for empty dict
-    eq(true, exec_lua([[return next(vim.api.nvim_call_function("FooFunc", {5})) == true ]]))
+    eq(
+      { {}, true, true },
+      exec_lua([[
+    local ret = vim.api.nvim_call_function("FooFunc", {5})
+    return {ret, vim.tbl_isempty(ret), next(ret) == nil}

comment_data.body: "API functions consistently return an empty dictionary as |vim.empty_dict()|. Before a |lua-special-tbl| was sometimes used. "
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -69,7 +69,8 @@ LSP

-â€¢ TODO

comment_regular_data.body:
And this special-cased test will have to be adapted:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/45b7a2c50335e1943a36715101e40eda5a1423f3/test/functional/lua/vim_spec.lua#L1208-L1209

> And this special-cased test will have to be adapted:
> 
> https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/45b7a2c50335e1943a36715101e40eda5a1423f3/test/functional/lua/vim_spec.lua#L1208-L1209

Thanks for the heads-up. Fixed it in the latest [ee08b7e](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/29659/commits/ee08b7ec32b0fdbe0b70f108673e500c1fd1feee). The now failing CI check seems to be flaky but I don't have permissions to re-run it (For the lint-commit check,I'll squash the commits once review completes).
Needs a note in `news.txt` as well, in `LUA` section in `BREAKING CHANGES` .  otherwise LGTM
Nitpick: since it's technically a breaking change the commit message should be "fix(lua)!:".

> Nitpick: since it's technically a breaking change the commit message should be "fix(lua)!:".

Done. I did look at the `news.txt` blame before squashing to see if all breaking changes are marked so, but it did not look like that ðŸ˜„

title: fix(lua)!: do not use typed table for empty dict
